result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Louis Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero). No fine. 
Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 08-11-2015.  Failure to pay all monies owed will result in a civil judgment.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Louis Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Louis Williams not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Defendant is deceased as of 8/6/18.  sb

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing JUNE 12, 2015 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  2  years with  Zero days credit; consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  1 year

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No fine
- Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 08-11-2015.  Failure to pay all monies owed will result in a civil judgment.

Jury trial is vacated.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Willie Louis Williams in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Willie Louis Williams in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court she is withdrawing the motion to suppress.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he may be deported if not a U.S. citizen, he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Willie Louis Williams in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Willie Louis Williams in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.12.15 and for jury trial on 6.24.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Louis Williams in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Willie Louis Williams in custody.  Ron Dague for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Lopez-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF869 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie Louis Williams in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Willie Louis Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
